channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: International students skipped campus this fall — and local economies lost $1 billion because of it
item.description: Hosting 21,587 fewer new international students means 7,300 fewer jobs and $500 million in lost labor income.

item.title: Trump’s Search for Powell’s Replacement Adds to Cacophony Around Interest Rate Decision
item.description: The end of Jerome Powell’s term as Fed chair will give President Trump his biggest opportunity yet to reshape the central bank.

item.title: Exclusive: Surf, an AI platform just for crypto, raises $15 million
item.description: The startup is backed by Pantera, Coinbase and DCG

item.title: At Fed Meeting, Interest Rate Cut Expected Amid Divisions
item.description: The central bank is poised to lower interest rates on Wednesday even as a growing chorus of officials urge caution.

item.title: Meta’s New A.I. Superstars Are Chafing Against the Rest of the Company
item.description: An us-versus-them mentality has emerged between Meta’s top artificial intelligence team and longtime lieutenants to Mark Zuckerberg.

item.title: America’s mobile housing affordability crisis reveals a system where income determines exposure to climate disasters
item.description: California lost 239,575 residents in 2024, the most of any state, while the housing market requires a $237,000 household income for a midtier house.

item.title: Goldman Sachs CFO on the company’s AI reboot, talent, and growth
Democrats Press to Expand House Map, Targeting 5 New G.O.P. Seats
item.description: Four of the additions are for districts where President Trump won handily, but Democrats are feeling emboldened by election outcomes this fall.

item.title: Political communication scholar on how Zohran Mamdani hacked ‘slacktivism’ to appear on your phone, on your street and in your mind
item.description: Campaigning increasingly occurs in what researchers call a “hybrid media” environment: in person, on the news and across multiple social media.

item.title: The Battle for Warner Bros. Discovery
item.description: Nicole Sperling, a Times reporter who covers Hollywood and the streaming revolution, breaks down the competing bids from Netflix and Paramount to buy ...

item.title: Khmer Rouge-Era Land Mines Have a Big Role in Thailand-Cambodia Conflict
item.description: Thailand says ordnance replanted by Cambodia has injured or maimed more than a dozen of its soldiers. Cambodia rejects the accusation.

item.title: Venezuela’s Nobel Peace Prize Winner Says She Will Appear in Oslo After Missing Ceremony
item.description: María Corina Machado, the Venezuelan opposition leader, said she was on her way to Norway after living in hiding in her country, where officials have ...

item.title: ISIS Detention Camps Pose a Dangerous Problem for Syria’s Leaders
item.description: The government faces a dilemma over what to do with civil-war-era prisons and detention camps that hold thousands of ISIS fighters and tens of thousan...

item.title: Map: 5.5-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Colombia
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: The Territorial Sticking Point Between Russia and Ukraine
item.description: The Kremlin says any peace deal must cede to Russia the entire eastern Donbas region, including territory Ukraine still controls — a nonstarter for Ky...
